oracle.lbs.mapclient
Class ScaleBarDef

java.lang.Object
  oracle.lbs.mapclient.ScaleBarDef
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class ScaleBarDef
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

This class provides the definition of a scale bar to MapViewer. An instance of this class must be set as part of your map request in order for a map to include such a scale bar.
The following code segment illustrates how to add a scale bar to your MapViewer-produced maps. 

     import oracle.lbs.mapclient.MapViewer;
     import oracle.lbs.mapclient.ScaleBarDef;

     MapViewer myReq = new MapViewer("http://www.my_corp.com:8888/mapviewer/omserver");
     ... //set up your mapviewer request information here...

     ScaleBarDef myScaleBar = new ScaleBarDef();
     myScaleBar.setPosition("SOUTH_EAST");
     myScaleBar.setMode("DUAL_MODES");  // display in both Metric and US units
     ... //you can customize other aspects of the Scale bar here

     //now we enable the scale bar
     myReq.setScaleBar(myScaleBar);  

     ... //proceed with your usual MapViewer request/response processing.

Since:
version 11

Constructor Detail

ScaleBarDef

public ScaleBarDef()
Creates an instance that contains the defintion of a default scale bar. A default scale bar in MapViewer has the following properties:
  • it uses two primary colors, off-white and off-black, both with a bit of transparency.
  • the scale bar displays only in Metric mode where the units will be kilometers, meters etc. If you need to display in the US or dual modes, use the method setMode to change it.
  • the labels on the scale bar will be displayed in the default Serif font with a 12 point size. The label will have a black foreground.

Method Detail

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
Clones object.

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
Returns:

setMode

public void setMode(java.lang.String mode)
Sets the rendering mode for a scale bar. Possible values are:
  • METRIC_MODE display the scale bar in the Metric system units
  • US_MODE display the scale bar in the US customery units
  • DUAL_MODES display the scale bar in both units

Parameters:
mode - the new mode to be used.

getMode

public java.lang.String getMode()
Returns the currently set display mode for the scale bar.

current mode

setLengthHint

public void setLengthHint(int lenHint)
Sets an hint for the length (in pixel) of the scale bar. Note that this is just a hint to MapViewer. It is likely to be adjusted slightly around the provided value for a better-looking scale bar.
If this value is set to 0, MapViewer will then automatically calculate an optimal" length which is dependent on the dimension of the requested map. The default value is 0.

Parameters:
preferredLength - the user's preferred length.

getLengthHint

public int getLengthHint()
Gets the currently set perferred scale bar length hint in pixel.

Returns:
preferred length in pixel

setLabelHaloSize

public void setLabelHaloSize(float labelHaloSize)
Sets the size (in pixel) of the white halo around each character of the label text on the scale bar. A typical (good) value will be either 2 or 3.0. If set to 0, there will be no halo around the label characters.

Parameters:
labelHaloSize - size of halo around each character on the scale bar.

getLabelHaloSize

public float getLabelHaloSize()
Gets the currently set size of the white halo around characters of the scale bar labels.

Returns:
current halo size for the label text

setPosition

public void setPosition(java.lang.String pos)
Sets the position for the scale bar within a map. Possible values are:
  • "SOUTH_EAST"
  • "NORTH_EAST"
  • "SOUTH_WEST"
  • "NORTH_WEST"
  • "NORTH"
  • "SOUTH"
Note that a scale bar is always horizontal.

Parameters:
pos - a string value from the above list

position
